summary: This document is a chronological log of psychological observations and suicide risk assessments conducted on Jeffrey Epstein while he was in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in July and August 2019. It details his mental state, complaints about confinement, interactions with staff and his cellmate, and the incident on July 23, 2019, where he was found with a string around his neck. The log concludes with his death by hanging on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the psychological observation log. Document details his mental state, complaints, interactions, and the events leading up to his death in custody.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: The medical professional (name redacted) conducting the psychological observations, suicide risk assessments, and clinical interviews with Epstein.

connections.description: Clinical relationship where Dr. assessed Epstein's mental health, suicide risk, and managed his psychological observation status.
Epstein reported conflicts with his cellmate, who allegedly called him a pedophile and, according to Epstein, may have been involved in the July 23 string incident.
Epstein frequently attended legal visits with his attorney (described as 'palm beach one'), during which he was observed discussing his case.

events.title: Epstein Arrives in General Population
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at the correctional facility and is placed in General Population (GP).

events.title: Initial Intake and Psychological Observation Ordered
events.description: Dr. conducts intake screening. After consulting with Central Office, Epstein is placed on psychological observation as a precaution pending a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA).

events.title: String Incident and Placement on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein is placed on Suicide Watch (SW) after a string is found loosely hanging from around his neck. He claims not to remember the event and suggests his cellmate may have been involved.

events.title: Post-Incident Report and Bail Denial
events.description: Dr. follows up after the string incident. Epstein expresses fear of his cellmate and reports his bail was recently denied.

events.title: Court Inquiry and Incident Report Expunged
events.description: A court sends a form regarding 'suicidal tendencies.' Epstein denies suicidality and states his incident report for self-mutilation (from July 23) was expunged.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found unresponsive and hanging in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 6:30 a.m., ten days after removal from constant observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) (inferred location of SHU/GP)
keyFacts: Epstein was placed on psychological observation and later suicide watch as a precaution, despite consistently denying any history or current thoughts of suicide.
On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found with a string loosely tied around his neck. He claimed no memory of the event and suggested his cellmate might have been responsible.
Epstein reported conflicts with his cellmate, who allegedly called him a pedophile and was agitated after reading a newspaper article about him.
Epstein's incident report for 'self-mutilation' related to the July 23 string event was later expunged, as noted in an August 1 assessment.
Jeffrey Epstein was found dead by hanging in his SHU cell on the morning of August 10, 2019.
